items.sentence: Tom and John are often mistaken for brothers.
Tom and John were fighting on the playground.
Tom and Mary are busy planning their wedding.
Tom and Mary are no longer on speaking terms.
Tom and Mary are on the verge of breaking up.
What\'s really going on between Tom and Mary?
What\'s the best way to avoid mosquito bites?
What\'s your favorite image editing software?
Tom thinks he\'ll go shopping this afternoon.
Your question is not relevant to the subject.
I can\'t communicate with Tom like I used to.
Tom\'s situation is getting more complicated.
What\'s your favorite non-alcoholic beverage?
I saw several people hanging out in the park.
I saw some empty bottles lying on the ground.
I saw the old man feed his dog chicken bones.
I don\'t see what you\'re so concerned about.
I don\'t think I\'m the only one who noticed.
I don\'t know when Tom is planning to arrive.
I don\'t know who Tom will go to Boston with.
Tom didn\'t want me to go to Boston with him.
Tom didn\'t want to admit that he was scared.
Tom didn\'t want to go, but Mary made him go.
Tom doesn\'t want Mary to go home by herself.
Tom doesn\'t want Mary to kiss him in public.
Tom doesn\'t want Mary to know what happened.
Tom doesn\'t want to admit that he was wrong.
Tom doesn\'t want to be seen talking to Mary.
Tom doesn\'t want to continue working for us.
Why don\'t you try minding your own business?
Why isn\'t that working? It worked yesterday.
Tom didn\'t have the courage to ask Mary out.
Tom didn\'t have the courage to disobey Mary.
Tom didn\'t know Mary used to live in Boston.
Tom didn\'t know that Mary understood French.
Tom didn\'t notice Mary hiding in the bushes.
You should take this a little more seriously.
Tom studied French last night until midnight.
Tom succeeded in finding a new job in Boston.
Tom succeeded in getting the truth from Mary.
Tom suddenly felt like he was going to faint.
Tom suggested going to Boston for the summer.
Tom suggested that I go to a movie with Mary.
Tom has a funny way of laughing, doesn\'t he?
Tom got out of his car and unlocked the gate.
Tom has three months left until he graduates.
Tom has two brothers who both live in Boston.
Tom held a small flashlight in his left hand.
Tom is busy making sandwiches in the kitchen.
You\'d better not swim if you\'ve just eaten.
